questions.question_text: How would you find a list of executables running from the Recycle Bin across your environment?

choices.D: Processes can't run from the Recycle Bin
choices.A: Executables running from Recycle Bin hunt report
choices.B: The only way to get this information is to copy the query from the Hunting Guide and search in Event Search
choices.C: There is no need for this report as it would always cause a detection in Falcon

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Investigate > Hunt > Executables running from Recycle Bin.

Selected Answer: A
A
In UI, Investigate > Hunt > Executables running from Recycle Bin

A. Executables running from Recycle Bin hunt report
A. There is a pre-configured report that can be run manually or scheduled.

Selected Answer: A
To see a list of executables running from the Recycle Bin, Falcon provides you a premade report on the Events Search page under Investigate > Hunt > Executables running from Recycle Bin. You can also run the following query.

So it is A and not B because both are an option and not only B

B is correct, sorry.

Selected Answer: A
I think the correct answer is A, there is a preconfigured report to get those processes. Option B, when indicating that "it is the only way" I would say, for what was said before, that it is incorrect, although it is indeed possible to use the guide's query.
